issue.title: Ignition GUI: Links in the image selection dropdown menu are mixed up

content.raw: Could you please describe your ignition GUI setup and config (version, any loaded configurations, any files you might be using, etc)?

issue.title: Ignition GUI: Links in the image selection dropdown menu are mixed up

content.raw:
I was using the docker image \( from about 7 weeks ago\). With the usage of multiple robots with two cameras there are a few image topics available. 

Isn’t it easily reproduceable?
content.html:
I was using the docker image ( from about 7 weeks ago). With the usage of multiple robots with two cameras there are a few image topics available.

Isn’t it easily reproduceable?

issue.title: Ignition GUI: Links in the image selection dropdown menu are mixed up

content.raw:
Thanks, I believe I have reproduced this issue.  It seems the pose for the cameras on the X1 Config 5 are backwards - the left HD camera is on the right and vice versa.  Is this the issue you were referring to?  If so, I've alerted the team and a fix will be issued as soon as possible.  If not, please describe more specifically which vehicle configurations were loaded, possibly with a gif of the issue, and more specific steps to reproduce this issue.  I loaded in multiple dual-camera robots simultaneously and everything seemed to be find other than the X1's cameras being reversed.

Thanks for helping us find these types of issues!
content.html:
Thanks, I believe I have reproduced this issue. It seems the pose for the cameras on the X1 Config 5 are backwards - the left HD camera is on the right and vice versa. Is this the issue you were referring to? If so, I've alerted the team and a fix will be issued as soon as possible. If not, please describe more specifically which vehicle configurations were loaded, possibly with a gif of the issue, and more specific steps to reproduce this issue. I loaded in multiple dual-camera robots simultaneously and everything seemed to be find other than the X1's cameras being reversed.

Thanks for helping us find these types of issues!

issue.title: Ignition GUI: Links in the image selection dropdown menu are mixed up

content.raw: I will look into it in more detail after the urban circuit. Only a short answer. I used 2 or 3 robots with different configurations with dual cameras. \(maybe X2-C5, X4-C5 and Sophisticated-Engineering-X4-C1\). Maybe this helps. More in a few days

issue.title: Ignition GUI: Links in the image selection dropdown menu are mixed up

content.raw:
@John Shepherd, 

Sorry, I totally forgot to answer you. I now checked it again and used the command: 

`./run.bash osrf/subt-virtual-testbed tunnel_circuit_practice.ign worldName:=simple_tunnel_03 robotName1:=X1n1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=X2n2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName3:=X3n3 robotConfig3:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_1`

So the most left robot is an X1, the robot in the middle is an X2 and the robot on the right is an X3 copter. 

After switching a little bit between the three images I got:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3880845302-Bildschirmfoto_von_2020-03-10_22-17-56.png)
The image is named X1n1 but it is obviously from the X3 copter.

And after switching again a little bit between the images I got:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/1210696411-Bildschirmfoto_von_2020-03-10_22-19-45.png)
Now the same image is named X2n2. That does not fit.
content.html:
@John Shepherd,

Sorry, I totally forgot to answer you. I now checked it again and used the command:

./run.bash osrf/subt-virtual-testbed tunnel_circuit_practice.ign worldName:=simple_tunnel_03 robotName1:=X1n1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=X2n2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName3:=X3n3 robotConfig3:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_1

So the most left robot is an X1, the robot in the middle is an X2 and the robot on the right is an X3 copter.

After switching a little bit between the three images I got:

The image is named X1n1 but it is obviously from the X3 copter.

And after switching again a little bit between the images I got:

Now the same image is named X2n2. That does not fit.
